definition: "to eat" or "food" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 184)
lit. to drool with desire (idiom)/fig. to hunger for/greedy
to have eyes bigger than one's belly (idiom)
to make one's mouth water/appetizing/greedy person/glutton
see 饞涎欲滴|馋涎欲滴[chan2 xian2 yu4 di1]

sentences.english: The sounds and smellsthatcame fromtheopen kitchen door appetizing.
sentences.chinese: 从敞着门的厨房飘进来的声音和气味让人发馋。

sentences.english: Ice cream always makes his mouth  water.
sentences.chinese: 冰淇淋总能让他馋得淌口水。

sentences.english: The sounds and smells that came from the open kitchen door were appetizing .
sentences.chinese: 从敞着门的厨房飘进来的声音和气味让人发馋。

sentences.english: The smells from the kitchen made my mouth water.
sentences.chinese: 厨房里的香味馋得我直流口水。

sentences.english: Wife greedy miser wine, usually drink Liang Zhong.
sentences.chinese: 吝啬鬼妻子馋酒，平常好喝两盅。

sentences.english: Always eating candy and teasing the kids without any.
sentences.chinese: 不停吃糖然后馋那些没糖的小孩。

sentences.english: Xiao Ming is greedy, his eyes will glow whenever he sees meat.
sentences.chinese: 小明特别馋，一看见肉就两眼放光。

sentences.english: He who conquers others is strong; He who conquers himself is mighty .
sentences.chinese: 征服他人是一个强者，但能征服自己馋是最伟大者。

sentences.english: This is under the greedy gluttonous kids bad.
sentences.chinese: 这些像是一个个小馋猫是的孩子们可馋坏了。

sentences.english: The delicacies on the table make him mouth water.
sentences.chinese: 倬上的美味佳肴馋得他直流口水。

sentences.english: My, U must be starved of Chinese food in Rome.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的娃，你在罗马一定因为吃不到中餐馋死了。

sentences.english: The sounds and smells that came from the open kitchen door were appetizing.
sentences.chinese: 从敞着门的厨房飘进来的声音和气味让人发馋。

sentences.english: When he saw the crow standing on the branch with the meat in his mouth, he swallowed and eagerly thought of a plan to get the meat.
sentences.chinese: 它一抬头，看见了乌鸦嘴里叼着的肉，馋得直流口水。

definition: to make one's mouth water/appetizing/greedy person/glutton
to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
lit. to drool with desire (idiom)/fig. to hunger for/greedy
to drool with desire (idiom); to envy/to hunger for
to let saliva dribble from the mouth/to slobber
to chew on a large slab (idiom); a large mouthful is hard to chew/to tuck into a great meal
